name: Escape Brooklyn
bio:
➸ Inspirational spaces, places & experiences
➸ Upstate NY travel guides, the best hotels, Airbnbs & real estate 
➸ Sister site to @escape_losangeles

social_posts.post_text:
It’s the most wonderful time of the year: soon snow will coat everything, ski slopes are open, shops are filled with fun holiday goods & wares, holiday drinks are flowing, and restaurants are buzzing. Today is the first of December and we just love all the good vibes this month brings! ✨

Everyone knows that experiences > stuff, so why not book a trip to treat your partner, your family, or even yourself this month?

Join the Escape Club email list & unlock monthly and seasonal promos — exclusive to our members — to some of our favorite Upstate hotels and Airbnbs 🌲

$6/month or $60/annually means you’ll get monthly discount codes, access to exclusive giveaways, monthly real estate intel from the regions top professionals, events heads up and more. Plus, you’re supporting our small business!

If you love Escape, this is a great way to show it; think of it as buying us a coffee once a month to keep us going ☕️ You know what to do — hit that link in bio & sign up today! 💌

Photos: 1 by Mike Ivers; 2 by Alon Reuveni; 5 by Tiffany Jen; 4, 8, 10 by Daniel Schwartz; all others by Escape Brooklyn.
Winter’s arrival ❄️ Today on the Hawk’s Nest Highway.

Still shopping for the holidays? 🎄 Alongside their very-giftable Catskills collection, our friends at @homestedt managed to dig up something very special this year: a collection of perfectly preserved hats and scarves made for the 1980 Lake Placid Winter Olympics!
 
Discovered on a trip to a mill in Upstate New York, these gems from the past had been sitting in an unopened box for 42 years, and are now being sold at @homestedt. 
 
Available to purchase online and in store while stocks last at homestedt.com — along with a collection of other unique gifts for the season. Priority shipping included for the next week.
 
Check the link in @escape_brooklyn and @homestedt bio to shop.

Photos: 1 by @escape_brooklyn; 2 & 5 by @catskillimage; 4 by @pbcrosby.

When snow’s in the forecast, we head to the hills: @callicoonhills, that is ✨

This century old resort nestled in a Catskills mountain valley is the perfect spot to cozy up this winter, where days are filled with outdoor activities – we highly recommend using their complimentary snow shoes out for a spin – or explore the region's lovely towns like nearby Livingston Manor, Roscoe, and Callicoon — all about a 15 minutes drive.

In the evening, head back to the hotel for the nightly bonfires in the backyard (grab a s’more kit!), or grab a drink at its onsite bar and restaurant Conover Club. Whether you’re using it as a home base to explore the Catskills region — or looking to check-in and “check out,” this decidedly laid-back hotel hits all the right notes. 

Don’t have NYE plans? 🥂 Join @callicoonhills for an NYE party to remember, with an open bar and plenty of food (including small plates & big bites.) Dance the night away, sleep in, then toast to 2023 in Conover Club the next morning — thankfully, brunch is just steps from your room.

Callicoon Hills rates begin $266/night. Join for NYE $292/night, plus $125/pp or $75/pp booze-free.

Head to the hills at the link in @callicoonhills & @escape_brooklyn bio. Photos: 1, 2, 5, 6, 8, 10 by Escape Brooklyn. 3 by Read McKendree. 4, 7, 9 by Mariah Wolfe.

Well… love it or hate it, winter’s here! ❄️ The Catskills got significant snowfall earlier this week, and is now underway a second storm bringing up to 2 feet to its high peaks.

Stay safe out there, New York!

Photos: by Sarah Zheng, spotted in the Catskills Trail Conditions Facebook group.

No, it’s not a snowy road in Upstate NY — it’s Joshua Tree! As captured by @escape_losangeles, our west coast sister site, for the freshly launched guide to this must-visit desert destination.

Known for its iconic landscapes and sunny skies — but also thriving arts, culinary & nightlife scenes — Joshua Tree is one of the most majestic spots the USA, if not the world. 🌵 It’s also the place Escape LA is fortunate enough to call home.

Straddling the Mojave Desert and the Colorado Desert ecosystems, Joshua Tree National Park may be the main attraction here, but the Escape LA guide delves deep into the region, with recommendations on where to eat, drink, and stay — plus loads of other ideas, like visiting an orchid greenhouse, off-roading festivals and locations, stargazing, sound baths and more. Favorite sights and hikes inside the park are listed, too.

Check out the @escape_losangeles guide at the link in bio, and plan a trip to this magical landscape this winter. 🌞 (And not to worry, the snow only happens once or twice a year.) 

Begin the trip flying into Palm Springs, the next forthcoming gujde on @escape_losangeles and a direct flight from JFK. Leave a recommendation for either location in the comments below. We’re listening!

New on EB: we went deep down the Zillow rabbit hole in our latest newsletter, to look back at home pricing in 2022 📈

We don’t know about you, but this team is addicted to Zillow. We love new listings – but what we love even more are new listings that are completely and utterly, even grotesquely out of our price range. We regularly scan for both in every county of the mid-Hudson Valley and the Catskills.

With that in mind, we’re sharing the results of some recent digging on the priciest home sales of 2022 in each county of the mid-Hudson Valley, and the Catskills: flaws and all, including not one but two, $10m+ discrepancies. (No biggie, Zillow, we all have our bad days.)

For the more practical, we’re also sharing the medians from each of those mid-Hudson Valley and Catskills counties. The market is at a strange crossroads, and who knows what 2023 will bring – but these numbers seem like a good place to begin. 

Sign up for the newsletter, link in bio.

Photos: 1, 4, 5 by Alon Koppel, @alonkoppelphotography in listing by @catskillmountainhouses. 2, 9 by Chris Davis in listing by @catskillcricket & @catskilldreamteam. 3, 8 by @dot.recordmedia/Treefalls Photography in listing by @jc.selling.westchester.ny. 6, 7, 10 by Sonja Zinke in listing by @elyse.harney.morris.

Happy New Year! Along with traveling more and spending less (which happens to be the theme of todays newsletter) we’ve resolved to give in and give IG reels another shot this year.

Calling all Escape followers and Reels fans: what do you want to see in this space? Hotel & home tours? Outdoor adventure? Itineraries? Upstate art & design? Anything? Nothing?

We’ll never stray from photos but would love to hear what YOU want to see this year, especially some guidance for Reels content. Drop a comment below, send a DM or heck, just join the email list to spend less while traveling more this year. Link in bio.

Happy New Year! ✨ As we were working on our resolution lists this year, two stood out, that surface level, seem contradictory: save more money, and travel more. Is this similar to your list? Well, do we have good news for you: these items need not be mutually exclusive.

This month, and every month of the year, our Escape Club newsletter shares Upstate hotels and Airbnbs with special offers & discounts, just for our paid Escape Club members — so you can feel good booking a city escape this winter. 

This month’s highlights include wellness weekends with included massages, a private ice skating rink, hot tubs with killer views, warm booze delivered to your hotel room, highly discounted stays, and even a few extra nights tossed in.

Not a subscriber yet? For $6/month, or $60 annually, membership pays for itself the moment you book something – plus it supports our small business. Good vibes all around. 

Sign up at the link in bio.

Photos: 1, 8 by Trevor Moran. 2, 6 by owners. 3-5, 7, 9 by @escape_brooklyn. 10 by Daniel Schwartz.

Weekend inspiration: @catskillscedarhouse, who has rare winter availability this upcoming weekend (and offering 20% off), plus a wide open spring & early summer on the recent release of those calendar dates.

This extra-cozy 3 bedroom vacation rental was originally built as a weekend ski home in the heart of the Catskills, just 2 hours from the GWB. 

The chalet-style home, nestled at the foot of a mountain, is surrounded by woods on three sides — and the perfect, private spot to unwind with friends and family in front of the fire in all seasons. 

Should you ever want to leave, @catskillscedarhouse is the perfect home base to explore all the region has to offer. Snow bunnies will love proximity to the slopes — it’s less than 30 minutes to Hunter Mountain & Plattekill, and less than 15 to Belleayre. ⛷

While you’re in town, head to picturesque Main Street in Phoenicia, hit the 3.5 mile Tanbark Trail, then reward yourself with a trip to the @phoeniciadiner, or @woodstockbrewing — or both.

Further afoot, the home is just 15 minutes to West Kill, with even better unparalleled scenery, excellent hiking (try Diamond Notch Falls), and the home to what many consider the best brewery in the Catskills: @westkillbrewing. 

Check out our mini-guide to the area, plus a link to book, at the link in bio. Direct book via the link in @catskillscedarhouse bio.

Photos: 1 c/o @catskillscedarhouse. 2-10 by @escape_brooklyn.

Taking inspiration from this attitude into 2023: “Sometimes you gotta suck it up and send it when your alarm goes off at midnight. Caught an epic sunrise at Giant Ledge which I shared with another hiker… Had a cup of hot coffee and smoked a J while watching Mother Nature at her best.”

Not bad! We applaud you @alyseford1016 and thanks for sharing! ✨ At Giant Ledge and Panther Mountain, Catskills.

Weekend inspiration: @nightfox_aframe in Livingston Manor, NY ❄️ 

This design-forward A-frame sleeps up to four guests with a spacious living/dining space that’s perfect to watch the snow fall from its large windows in all directions, while keeping toasty next to the wood burning stove.

Less than 10 minutes away, enjoy some of the regions best hiking trails, including a waterfall in the Willowemoc Wild Forest, or the popular loop around Frick Pond — both great for snow shoeing. For the less outdoorsy inclined, it’s also just 15 minutes into Livingston Manor, making it easy to visit some of the best Catskills’ restaurants, breweries, and shopping — plus, the newly opened @catskillartspace. (Check the mini-guide via the link in bio for our recommendations.)

The winter calendar still has some availability at @nightfox_aframe, with just a few weekends left all season. Of note: Escape Club members can enjoy 10% weekly bookings this season at @nightfox_aframe. Inquire within, or join our newsletter to unlock this special rate.

Link to book in @nightfox_aframe bio; link to our mini-guide, plus the link to book, in @escape_brooklyn bio.

Weekend inspiration: spend a winter weekend at the dreamy @catskillscloudhouse, our go-to, no-car-needed getaway location of Phoenicia, NY ✨

Its newest amenity, a private ice rink – flanked on two sides with fire pits – transforms the back yard space, with views of the surrounding mountains and pine trees. It’s the perfect way to spend a winter day, before or after a day on the nearby Tanbark Trail or exploring town. (Ice rink is subject to seasonality; inquire within.)

This bright, airy farmhouse is nestled in heart of the Catskills, but ideally located with everything you need for a perfect weekend getaway within walking distance of its front doorstep — including meals and supplies, hiking, or fishing in the Esopus Creek. 

Three bedrooms accommodates six guests at the Catskills Cloud House, also equipped with the most beautiful, open-concept kitchen/dining space for cooking up tasty meals — to be enjoyed in the airy dining space or cozy living room.

Hop on the Trailways Bus ASAP for this easy Catskills getaway that doesn’t require a car. For our mini-guide to the area, plus a link to rates & availability, check the link in our bio. 

Photos: 1, 5, 9 and 10 by @catskillscloudhouse; 2-4, 6-8 by @escape_brooklyn

Weekend inspiration: @pine_crest_creek in Delancey, NY ✨

This cozy modern getaway in the woods 120 miles from NYC sits on 5 acres in the Catskills, with soaring pine trees, and a hidden creek at the end of a short scenic trail.

During winter, spend your days exploring the nearby towns of Delhi, Stamford and Bovina — stretching your legs on hiking trails (Bramley Mountain is our favorite), shopping the boutique shops in Delhi (we love @thisandthatdelhi & @thestonehouseshop) and Stamford (@catskilloutpost, @tandemantiques, & @stamfordcoffee) — then grab a meal out or head back to the house and make use of the well-equipped kitchen. At the end of the day, throw a record on the turntable and enjoy a nightcap by the cozy wood burning stove.

Pine Crest Creek is freshly launched, with lots of availability this winter, including holidays! Check the link in bio for rates & availability, plus our mini-guide.

Photos: 2,10 c/o @pine_crest_creek; all others by @escape_brooklyn.
Nothing like a fresh coat of snow (or a snowshoe adventure to see it all) in the Catskills ❄️ at Balsam Mountain Fire Tower outside Livingston Manor, NY.

GIVEAWAY! to the Poconos, with a stay at @thetreetopchalet_pa this spring ✨

Though it’s barely almost February, we’re looking forward to spring and a return to the outdoors… specifically to days spent on the river or hiking waterfalls, which come rushing back to life each spring with winter’s snowmelt. 

With this in mind, we’re pairing up with @thetreetopchalet_pa in the land of rivers and waterfalls — the Poconos — in which one lucky winner will receive a two-night stay this spring at @thetreetopchalet_pa, plus a $50 gift certificate at your preferred local libation location: @threehammerswinery or @wallenpaupackbrewingco.

Spend your days exploring the nearby trails (we love Tusten Mountain Trail, Promised Land State Park) and waterfalls (Shohola, Hackers, Dingmans and Raymondskill Falls) — then recap the day over drinks at Three Hammers Winery, or Wallenpaupack Brewing, both of which are close proximity to the house. At night, cook a meal in the well-appointed kitchen, then have a nightcap by the fireplace, or the outdoor fire pit under the stars.

Redeemable March 1 through May 1, 2023. (But skiers take note, on a pre-spring note: all guests at @thetreetopchalet_pa get 25% off lift tickets to nearby Big Bear, 5 minutes from the home.)

To enter: follow @thetreetopchalet_pa and @escape_brooklyn; like the post and tag up to three travel buddies below for a chance to enter!

Rules: you must be 21+ to win. Booking subject to availability with some holiday blackout dates. Prize must be redeemed by May 1, 2023. 

‼️ IMPORTANT ‼️Winner will be chosen & announced 👉🏻 on this post, by @escape_brooklyn 👈🏻 ONLY ‼️ on February 4, 2023. Any notifications/messages from any other profiles imitating Escape Brooklyn or Treetop Chalet are fake and should be reported as spam.‼️ Good luck!

Weekend Inspiration: Huckleberry House, a modern Catskills getaway in Margaretteville, NY.

Two bedrooms and two bathrooms accommodates four at Huckleberry House; a detached studio with serious treehouse vibes sleeps two additional guests. Gather 'round the stone fireplace in cold months; in spring & summer, enjoy al fresco meals on the patio surrounded by the sounds of nature. A firepit on a stone patio is enjoyable year-round.

Surrounded by ~3 acres of forest and babbling brooks, Huckleberry House is nestled between two Catskills Park trailheads: Huckleberry Loop and Kelly Hollow Trail. It's location makes it the perfect getaway for hikers; plus, a soaking tub is the perfect spot to unwind after a day climbing mountains (or just relaxing.) 

Conveniently located 5 minutes from Margaretville's Main St – with charming restaurants, boutique shopping and more – plus close to Roxbury, Andes, Bovina, and ski mountains @plattekill_mtn or @belleayre.

Winter holidays are still available; rates begin at $250/night. Check the link in bio for availability.

Photos: 1-5 by @castilloalec

Hot off the presses, our monthly Escape Club Real Estate Newsletter just went out, and this month’s topic is style ✨

For many, this is the starting point of the real estate process: whether you’re dreaming of a Scandinavian cabin in the woods, a midcentury home on the river, a Hudson Valley farmhouse or just something cheap, you may have a specific style in mind. We want to help you find and design your dream home.

For each of these categories (farmhouse, cabin, midcentury and fixer upper) we’re sharing tips including the best Upstate locations and listing agents to – plus, resources including local shops and design studios to check out, a wealth of websites, inspirational home design books featuring local artists and authors, newsletters and more.

Sign up at the link in bio. ✨ 

Photos: 1 by @catskillimage at @homestedt’s Blackberry House, listed by @catskillmountainhouses. 2 by @uplandcreative.co at a recent @freshairny listing in Margaretville, NY. 3 and 8 by @escape_brooklyn at vacation rental @roscoefarmhouse. 4 and 10 by @philmansfieldphotography at @upstatecurious listing in Shohola, PA. 5 and 7 by @selliottphoto from Upstate, by @brass__tacks. 6 by @catskillimage at @ahouseupstate listing Fishkill Farm. 9 by @escape_brooklyn at vacation rental @hurleywhirley. 
—
Other honorable mentions in our newsletter/design inspiration include: @jerseyicecreamco, @cabinporn, @cabinlove, @cheapoldhouses, @thecreativesagent, @takesunset, @themillievintage, @dwellmagazine, @longweekend, @taylorandace, @zioandsons, @thisoldhudson, @countryhouserealty, @elledecor, @archdigest, @thefarmhouseproject, @the_antique_warehouse, @modern_hudson.

While NYC has seen historic non-snowfall, at least some of the Upstate region is a winter wonderland right now (but🤞🏻 for more, surely)… so if snow is on your bucket list this year, you’d better look up. Upstate that is.

In this month’s Escape Club Newsletter, we’re sharing ten Upstate hotels and Airbnbs with special offers and discounts, just for our paid Escape Club members, so you might actually get a shot at enjoying some white powdery stuff this season – and save some dough while doing it.

Highlights this month include: a private ice skating rink, hot tubs with views, cozy saunas, sleigh rides on a farm, gratis warming booze and foods, in-bedroom fireplaces, massage/wellness packages… and seriously (10-25%) discounted stays, free nights or indulgent perks at every single property.

Not a subscriber yet? For $6/month, or $60 annually, membership pays for itself the moment you book something – plus it supports our small business. Good vibes all around.

✨ Sign up at the link in bio for access to the entire Escape Club archive, including February’s newsletter with the deals above ✨

Cold enough for you?! Currently -9° in our Catskills home base, Livingston Manor.

Photo: @aaron.i8_visuals, Awosting Falls in Minnewaska State Park, in #escapebrooklyn. Thanks for tagging!

Choose from one of the four below — then use the Escape Brooklyn Guide to Kingston, NY to get inspired:

💗 Valentine’s package: receive a $150 credit for a romantic dinner at Restaurant Kinsley, singles or couples massage, or gifts from Kinsley’s retail offerings –  included with any 2-night stay between Friday, February 10th and Thursday, February 16th.

🔥 Cozy Nights package: get warm glögg delivered to your room, plus a gifted candle by Soho menswear brand NOAH, included in any 2-night stay. Book a room with a fireplace or soaking tub for maximum cozy vibes! (See list in comments! ✨) Now through March 30.

🥾 Weeknight Adventurer: get hiking passes to Mohonk Preserve or select NY State Parks, complimentary wine from @kingstonwineco, and a complimentary guided hike for one with @upstatehiking. (Upgrade available: $125 to add a second person for hike.)

✨ Escape Club newsletter members take an additional 10% off the Cozy Nights & Stay, Ski & Save Packages — or 20% off  ANY stay at Hotel Kinsley, when not combined with another offer, all winter long.

social_posts.post_text:
On view: @catskillartspace’s first exhibitions of 2023 featuring the sculptural work of Judith Henry, Samuelle Green and Lizzie Wright ✨

In Livingston Manor, the recently revamped space re-opened its doors in November 2022, featuring world-class art from names like Sol LeWitt and James Turrell — plus rotating exhibitions showcasing regional talent. 

From now through March 18, 2023, explore sculpture installations by Judith Henry, Samuelle Green and Lizzie Wright, whose work explores the intersection and divergence of contemporary sculptural practices utilizing found objects. Through playful and sardonic humanoid shapes, Henry employs detritus to examine the myriad identities of the self. Green, meanwhile, invites contemplation on our ontological relationship to her architectural forms rendered in found paper. Wright carries viewers up, her apparitions taking shape through discarded materials, illuminated with glowing light. Together, the presentation reflects disparate perspectives on what it is to be human, from human forms and experiences to visions of an afterlife. 

The exhibition will be on view on the ground floor galleries of Catskill Art Space, 48 Main Street, Livingston Manor, NY from now through March 18, 2023. Exhibition hours are Friday and Saturday, 11am – 5pm, and Sunday 11am – 3pm. Admission to @catskillartspace is free; contributions help bring world-class art and diverse cultural programming to the Catskills. Check the link in bio to plan a trip and get more information on upcoming exhibitions at @catskillartspace.

Photos: Zach Hyman @hyman.zach

Only one month ’til spring, but who’s counting? This week’s snowy forecast is reminding us it is very much still winter in the Catskills. 

Soon enough we’ll be starting to look for signs of spring, but for now, we’re embracing the late winter cycle of snow and thaw, that bring our local waterways to life — plus the most picturesque, foggy mountain sunsets. 

Photo from 5:41 pm today, caught by a guest of @themountainwonder, a favorite EB getaway.

Weekend inspiration c/o @cabin_vermont. These two modern & magical cabins are nestled into a forested 20-acre plot in South Royalton, Vermont where it’s forecasted to get up to a foot of snow this week. ✨❄️

Designed with Scandinavian sensibilities, both make use of large picture windows, offering views of the falling snow, swaying trees, resident chipmunks and other wildlife. They were created as a labor of love by the Dutch couple who designed them; their modern, Scandinavian style is an unusual discovery in rural Vermont.

The Chalet is the larger of the two, suitable for up to six guests, with Nordic design sensibilities on full display: a white & blond wood palette, polished concrete floors, 22ft ceilings and windows that flood the space with natural light. Adjoining the kitchen and dining space, its large living room is anchored with a wood burning stove. Pick a book from the floor-to-ceiling bookshelves, or set up a movie on the projector, and cozy up as nights closes in.

Not far away, the Cabin is an inviting studio space with a kitchenette and wood burning stove. It’s small footprint, open floor plan, and large windows give us treehouse vibes; a perfect spot for forest immersion. 

Both properties are pet and family-friendly, and feature fire pits, lounge chairs, grills and seasonal outdoor showers. 🚿 

Last but not least, a private hiking trail on this 20 acre property is perfect for snowshoeing (or warm weather hiking) — with gorgeous views over the Vermont Hills. 

Just 25 minutes to the storybook town of Woodstock, VT for additional amenities including Saskadena 6 ski resort, the Woodstock Inn Spa, plus Woodstock’s boutiques and eateries. 

Book now to enjoy the last licks of winter — paid Escape Club subscribers members get 25% off a third night (DM for the code, or wait for our March 1 mailer.) Link to book, with rates and availability, at the link in bio.

Photos: Chadwick Estey @chadwick_vt

Weekend inspiration: take in the warm spring & summer days ahead at @willowemochideaway, a modern getaway cabin in Parksville, NY ✨

Three bedrooms accommodates up to eight guests at the Willowemoc Hideaway, with tons of spaces to soak in the surrounding landscape, both inside and out. 

Start your morning with coffee or sun salutations in the screened-in sunroom, located just off an airy & well-equipped kitchen. The dining space beyond accommodates up to eight guests; or prepare and enjoy meals al fresco, on the large deck with a grill.

Easily accessible outdoor spaces include a hammock and screened-in gazebo, tucked just beyond the house in the forest — plus the adjoining state land, part of Willowemoc State Forest with 40+ miles of trails (see our recs in the linked guide.) Loads of cute shops, cafes and breweries in nearby Livingston Manor and Roscoe, plus world-class fly fishing, are just minutes away. 

No matter how you spend your day, gather by the bonfire in the evening, where the surrounding towering trees are illuminated by lights, accentuating the majesty and magic of the Catskills forest. 

Calendar just opened up for spring and summer — book now! Check out our mini-guide to the area, plus rates and availability for @willowemochideaway, at the link in bio.

New on EB: we’ve got two new newsletters for subscribers this week! ✨

First, celebrate the season of re-growth and confusing weather (Will it snow? Will it be 70º?) away from the city, and dive into the outdoors.

Escape Club subscribers are getting access to ten exclusive promo codes for some of our favorite Upstate (and beyond, to Vermont) locations. Our Airbnb & hotel partners are offering up to 20% off stays, free nights, complimentary booze and more – just for Escape Club subscribers. 

Second, we’re profiling design studio @homestedt’s new project: building stylish, well-built, energy efficient homes in the Catskills – in a matter of months. We’re sharing some favorite details, as well as what to expect, from pricing to timeline of these new builds, in yesterday’s newsletter.

Subscribe now for access to the entire Escape Club archive, hosted on Substack. 📝 Link in bio. 

Photos: 3, 4, 6-9 by @escape_brooklyn. 1 c/o @unwindcatskills. 2 by @taradonne.studio. 5 by @chadwick_vt. 10 by @hellowithyou.

New in EB real estate: the one-in-a-million Cochecton Pump House (@cochectonpumphouse), 120 miles from NYC in Cochecton, NY.

From an overgrown ruin, new life has been breathed into this solid, concrete and brick structure built by Standard Oil in 1879. Fast forward 143 years — Cochecton Pump House has created an entirely one-of-kind restaurant, bar and event space. 

Tucked into the upper Delaware River valley, it’s conveniently located between two hotbeds of the Sullivan Catskills renaissance, Narrowsburg and Callicoon. 

The sale includes:
💰 Turn key business opportunity;
🏰 3800 square foot original concrete & structure, dating to 1879;
🍻 Two modified containers (bar & kitchen) and one trailer (bathrooms);
🏡 Three bedroom, one bathroom classic farmhouse on ~3 acres

Last, this preservation project received an Excellence Award by the Preservation League of New York State, a testament to the incredible work that’s been done here. 

Asking $1.2m. More pics and info, link in bio.

Listed by @catskills_living Erik Freeland, County House Realty. For showings or info, email erik@countryhouserealty.net or call/text (646) 942-7099.

Snow day! ⛄️ Much of the Catskills is getting 1’+ of snow (and some areas up to 2’) with the mark of spring just one week away.

What do you think — last one?! ❄️ 

Photos c/o @elmgardendesign on their lush and picturesque flower farm in Livingston Manor, in winter rest mode.

Weekend inspiration: book an exceptional spa retreat at @kenozahall’s Hemlock Spa in Kenoza Lake, NY ⛲️

110 miles from NYC, this 32-room boutique hotel has an onsite spa, bar and restaurant — so you can check in and unwind, without ever having to leave the property. 

Refresh and restore with Kenoza Hall’s unique brand of "earthy luxury," featuring Kneipp-inspired body treatments and massages, an ode to the area’s early Swiss and German settlers 🌿 

Treatments, rooted in naturopathy and hydrotherapy, extend beyond the walls of the Hemlock Spa, and into the 55 acres of land which include walking paths, artfully designed gardens, an outdoor barrel sauna, hot tub, and pool.

Just as indulgent as its spa is Kenoza Hall’s lake view restaurant, serving Old World Continental Cuisine, with menu classics like Oysters Rockefeller, Pan Roasted Chilean Sea Bass, and Gnocchi Parisienne. 

Hotel and spa guests are welcome to use the grounds, including hiking trails, greenhouse, sauna and hot tub. The seasonal pool may be used anytime by hotel guests, with some availability to spa guests, depending on capacity. Public is welcome at the bar and restaurant. And when you’re ready to explore, the hip, bustling town of Livingston Manor is just 15 minutes away.

Rates begin at $350-500/night depending on season; to book a package — or to get ahead of planning a summer spa vacation — click the link in bio.

Photos: @uplandcreative.co

Astronomical #spring began at 11:33 a.m. ET today, and you better believe we’re thrilled about it.

Here’s to resilience, warmer temperatures, new life, and all the sunrise and sunset hikes.

Spring has officially sprung, and we’re so ready to refresh and renew after a long, dark winter. To help our readers plan a much-deserved recharge, we’ve rounded up some of our favorite wellness and spa getaways north of NYC.

✨Get the scoop at the link in bio ✨

Photos: 1 by Sean Davidson; 2, 4, 9 by Upland Creative; 3, 6 by Andrea Killam Photography; 5 by Escape Brooklyn; 7, 10 by Ben Fitchett; 8 by Harrison Lubin.

Toast to spring at the Catskills Spring Run this April! 🥂✨

This unique tasting tour runs Saturdays in April, where guests are transported to three distinctive Catskills makers of spirits and cider throughout the scenic Delaware River Valley region. Taste some of the the region’s best librations, snack, socialize, and celebrate the return of spring in the Catskills. 

Transportation is provided by @upstate_d_tours; tickets are ~$35. Itinerary includes:

🐝 12 PM: meet at @catskillprovisionsny for a tasting of their honey-infused spirits, plus a variety of wine and beer options along with small plates;
🥃 1:30: shuttle to @rock.valley.spirits where guests will learn about the art & science of traditional artisan distilling followed by a tasting;
🍎 3:30: take a mini-tour of cidery @seminaryhillny — where guests will taste some ciders, snacks, appetizers, entrees and desserts crafted to bring out Seminary Hill’s complex aromas.

✨ Optional: should you anticipate getting carried away drinking in all the fun, make a weekend of it with a stay at @seminaryhillny's own boutique hotel, the Seminary Hill Boarding House. Seventeen unique shaker-style rooms are as chic as they are cozy, and the hotel is walkable into town. Rate begin ~$300/night.

Our full feature on Seminary Hill, including other activities in the area like hiking, canoeing, shopping and more — plus the link to purchase tickets to Spring Run — at the link in bio.

Photos: 1-3, 5, 7, 9, 10 by @hellowithyou. 4 c/o @catskillprovisionsny. 6, 8 c/o @rock.valley.spirits.

Weekend inspiration: spend a spring weekend at the airy @catskillscloudhouse, our go-to, no-car-needed getaway location of Phoenicia, NY ✨

This bright, dreamy farmhouse is nestled in heart of the Catskills, but ideally located with everything you need for a perfect weekend getaway within walking distance of its front doorstep — including meals and supplies, hiking, or fishing in the Esopus Creek. 

Three bedrooms accommodates six guests at the Catskills Cloud House, also equipped with the most beautiful, open-concept kitchen/dining space for cooking up tasty meals — to be enjoyed in the airy dining space or cozy living room.

Spend days exploring town, hiking the nearby Tanbark Trail (walkable from town) or just hanging in the back yard space, with views of the surrounding mountains and tall pine trees. 

Hop on the Trailways Bus ASAP for this easy Catskills getaway that doesn’t require a car. (And for those driving, there’s a handy EV charger.) For our mini-guide to the area, plus a link to rates & availability, check the link in our bio.

Weekend inspiration: this warm weather has us dreaming about summer — summer in the #Adirondacks, that is 🌲🛶🥾 

At six million acres large, the Adirondack Mountains are the largest protected natural area in the lower 48 states. The park is bigger than the Yellowstone, Everglades, Glacier, and Grand Canyon National Park combined — and it’s right in our backyard!

Last year, we visited, photographed and created guides for three incredible lodging options in three different and beautiful Adirondack landscapes, and we’ve got a full recap at the link in bio.

There’s a little something for everyone — whether you’re a solo traveler, adventurous couple, or a group of family and friends. Enthusiasts of all hobbies and skill levels can hike extraordinary trails, canoe breathtaking ponds and lakes – or spend days traversing the cultural offerings of the region’s shopping, food and breweries.

For @sprucetoninn, it’s been an amazing ten years of long summer days, creekside afternoons, morning hammock hangs, brilliant sunsets… and ten amazing years of hosting! ✨

The boutique hotel in West Kill, NY is celebrating its 10th year of business all summer long, and is releasing their 2023 calendar this week. 

Guests only need to step out their door to be totally immersed in nature; its super rural location is divine, with eight acres of land, plus creek access for five of the seven miles down a dead-end dirt road where the hotel is located. Nine simple, yet cozy rooms feature big windows to take in the surrounding meadow and mountains. Rather conveniently, the 10th room is a bar.

For those seeking even more solitude and nature vibes, the hotel is within walking distance to miles of pristine trails – including a waterfall. And for those not, it’s within stumbling distance of the award-winning @westkillbrewing, with delicious beer and food.

Given its small size, and for-obvious-reasons popularity, this is a hotel whose calendar books up fast. (Last year, half of the season was booked within a week of opening reservations.) So we’re giving our followers a leg up on snagging a much-sought-after reservation this season: this week, you can join the mailing list at Spruceton Inn to receive a secret reservation link before the calendar gets released to public this Friday. 

At our link in bio, see our recent profile on @sprucetoninn that includes a summer calendar of events (think: bar hours, art events) — plus info on their artist in residence program, where artists can apply to be granted a 5-night stay at the hotel and get some much-needed creative time in the Catskills. 

Happy travels, and congrats again to our pals at @sprucetoninn on ten amazing years. 💗🌿

This unique opportunity allows guests to spend one or two weeks, each month, for a year — with a half ($24k) or quarterly ($14k) lease share. No need to pack unpack with onsite locked storage; enjoy an authentic second home experience without all the expense and responsibilities of home ownership. Utilities and lawn upkeep are included.

Centrally located in Sullivan County, the River Trail House is 10 miles from the historic Woodstock site, Bethel Woods — and close to the river towns of Narrowsburg, Callicoon, and Livingston Manor. 

Located on 700 feet of the Mongaup River frontage, this charming 3BR/2BA house with a cool “lodgey” vibe, checks all the boxes for an ideal escape back to nature. Pets welcome!

Weekend inspiration: escape to one of four totally unique, refreshingly off-grid accommodations at @bellfirefarm this season ✨

Take a deep digital detox and spend some time reconnecting with nature at Bellfire, whose 10 acre property includes a maple forest, wildflower field, and miles of space to roam. 

This creative, small footprint retreat was designed with an emphasis on big experience — providing a magical home base for guests to unwind between forest bathing, cooking over an open fire, hiking the property, or sauna sessions followed by rinses in an outdoor shower.

Bellfire’s unique accommodations include:

💫 Cosmic Nomad: a meticulously detailed covered wagon with two queen-size, bunk-style beds;
🖼️ Bird House: tiny house with 11ft-tall window wall, framing the sprawling, lush landscape – plus a 6 ft skylight above the bedroom for maximum stargazing;
⛺️ Bellfire Tipi: glamping tipi with two twin beds, custom-made furniture, cedar floors, and indoor chiminea;
🌲 Forest Belle: luxury tent decorated with modern decor, including a queen size bed.

No two sites are the same, but all have solar showers and compositing toilets, hammocks, picnic tables, and grill and/or fire areas for cooking and stargazing. (Speaking of stargazing, Bellfire is located in a blue zone, designated as one of the best places for stargazing in Upstate NY 💫!) A sauna and large yoga deck are available for guest use, as well.

Rates at Bellfire begin $185/night; book direct on their site to save on Airbnb fees, and join the Escape Club newsletter to save 15% on any two night stay (mailer goes out May 1). Check the link in bio to be taken to Bellfire’s website, where you’ll find its booking calendar — plus additional information, like things to do in the area, and group booking/event info.

Checking in: @thedebruce in Livingston Manor, NY ✨

This one-of-kind hotel in the Catskills has carved a name for itself as a must-visit for foodies, where hotel guests are treated to two outstanding, memorable meals each day — breakfast and dinner — in a glass-walled dining room overlooking the mountains, pool, pond, and surrounding landscape.

Sunday through Friday, an a la carte menu is served, while Saturday offers an immersive tasting menu experience where all guests are served all courses at the same time as a collective group. (Non-guests are welcome with advance reservation.) 

The DeBruce’s culinary menus change often with the season — sometimes even daily, so even for locals there’s always something new and exciting. More adventurous guests can opt for a Carte Blanche menu, where the chef de cuisine and culinary team send out a selection of off-menu items, for an even more interactive culinary experience. 

Between meals, hang at the pool, hike the private trails on the property, or take fly-fishing lessons from some of the area’s top guides. 👙🥾🎣

Ten minutes into Livingston Manor, explore it’s Main Street with a world-class art gallery, bars and breweries, plus excellent shopping. We’ve got a full guide on EscapeBrooklyn.com with all our favorite things to do, eat and see! 🛍️🍻🖼️ 

Rates begin at $~799/night in summer, which includes the most memorable breakfasts and dinners available in the Catskills — plus access to its grounds, pool and private trails. The DeBruce is dog friendly.

On radar: @catbirdfestival ✨ For the first time since the 1969 Woodstock festival, a new music and camping festival will debut on the same historic field at Bethel Woods this August 19 & 20 in Bethel, NY.

This new music festival features alt-folk names like The Lumineers, The War on Drugs, and Band of Horses —  plus country talent like Tyler Childers, Charley Crockett and Margo Price. 🎸

Camping options include car camping, RV camping — or rent a canvas glamping tent with cushy queen/twin beds and restrooms with showers. ⛺️ 

Tickets begin $140 for one day general admission, $200 for both days GA — or book a platinum experience for extra-special perks like the complimentary bar, dedicated concierge, premium entrance and parking, and exclusive front-of-strage viewing. 

✨⛺️ Check the link in bio for festival lineup, information and tickets 🎟️🎸

On our radar: FISH, FOWL & FOREST: an @upstateartweekend event featuring the work of Steven Weinberg, Jamie Kennard, and Arc Ceramics at West Kill Brewing. 🍻 The show takes place on Saturday July 22 and Sunday July 23, from 12-6 pm.

After years of being neighbors and friends, these talented artists have also become artistic collaborators. Illustrator/painter Steven Weinberg and photographer Jamie Kennard are adventure partners, frequently traveling, hiking, fishing and skiing together. 

During their adventures, Steven tells us, "I paint the scenes and fish; Jamie photographs everything.” Meanwhile, just down the road from Steven’s own studio, Arc Ceramic’s Sarah Mitchell makes sculptural, nature-inspired pottery — and Steven paints over it.

Steven describes the collaborations as an encapsulation of his Catskills dream: wildly talented friends who live just down the road from each other, who get to explore the woods and make art together. (And perhaps share the occasional West Kill brew or three.) The trio is thrilled for their first group show in the place they’re fortunate to call home.

Paintings (originals and prints) by @steven_draws Steven Weinberg, photography by @catskillktracks Jamie Kennard and ceramics by Sarah Mitchell @arc_ceramics will be on view and for sale at FISH, FOWL & FOREST at West Kill Brewing, Saturday July 22 and Sunday July 23, 12-6 pm. 

Support these artists and more at the upcoming @upstateartweekend, taking place July 21 through 24, 2023 all over the Hudson Valley and Catskills. 

Head to upstateartweekend.org for a complete schedule and map!

Natural wine, open-fire cooking, craft beer & cocktails: we’re pleased to report the delicious union of @sunshinecolony and @thehighmeadowproject in Livingston Manor, NY 🍷🔥🍕 

Soon after its doors opened in early 2020, this petite wine bar was forced to close them due to the pandemic. After years of careful adapting — it survived on serving to-go beverages and food for some four-ish months — a re-opening followed, its patio was expanded, and Sunshine Colony continued to literally blossom into the charming indoor/outdoor wine bar that it is today. 

This summer, a number of fun changes have taken place, including a lively calendar of events (Sunday bluegrass jam brunch, or the occasional FIFA screenings), a lovely garden & patio build-out… and best of all, the addition of the outdoor kitchen and menu by @thehighmeadowproject. 

Tucked behind this Main Street bar on its lush, oversize stone patio, Sunshine Colony guests can watch as chef Johnny Anderes cooks up an ever-changing, seasonal menu of delicious wood-fired foods (think pizzas, burgers, fish and roasted veggies) and snacks that just so happen pair *perfectly* with wine. 🥂 

Food is cooked in a magical setting in its central outdoor space, filled with plants and flowers of all sorts, loads of outdoor seating, strings of lights, patio heaters (if you need ‘em), and the tempting aromas drifting from chef Johnny’s pizza oven and wood-fired grill.

Keep up to date with the current menu and events at the @sunshinecolony profile, and add this to your Catskills vacation bucket-list! 📝

120 miles from NYC, the town of Roscoe has earned its place on the map for attracting anglers from around the globe. 🎣 

The town, affectionately dubbed Trout Town USA, is renowned for its plentitude of streams, lakes and reservoirs — abundant with trout — that wind their way through its sprawling forests. 

Beyond its fishy fame, however, Roscoe reels in throngs of visitors for more than what its pristine waters promise.

At the link in bio, plan a trip using the Escape Brooklyn Guide to Roscoe, NY — where you’ll find our favorite hikes, shops, restaurants, and lodging — plus an alpaca farm with tours that’ll give you the warm fuzzies for years to come.

Photos: 1 c/o @buckbrookalpacas; 2, 3, 5, 10 by @escape_brooklyn; 4, 7 by @castilloalec; 6, 8, 9 c/o @plumguide
The end of summer, doing its thing, at @sprucetoninn ✨ Happy 10 years to this real-deal country getaway; a very favorite Catskills bed & bar.

We don’t know about you, but the end of summer can bring some pretty mixed feelings... Truth be told, we’re sunshine people. 

Thankfully, September is always incredible Upstate. It’s the perfect capstone. It gives pretty equal parts summer days, to be spent at the swimming hole and dinners outdoors — along with some cooler ones, perfect for hiking and drinks by a fire. 🔥 (Plus, it’s usually sunny.)

You might say that with this range of weather & outdoor activities, September is the Best Month All Year.

Wherever you land on the September spectrum, we got you, and for all weather conditions too. In today's newsletter, we’re sharing nine Upstate hotels and Airbnbs that were kind enough to share exclusive  promos with our paid ($6/mo or $60/annual) readers for the month of September — arguably the Best Month All Year. ✨

If you’re not part of the list, join up at the link in bio! Newsletter goes out at noon. (And if you ever miss a newsletter, access the entire archive on the web — same link.) 📝

Photos: 1, 2, 4 9 by @escape_brooklyn; 3 by @sasithonphoto; 5, 10 by @uplandcreative.co; 6 by Ron Cadiz Photography; 8 by @dirtandglass.

In Callicoon, NY, @seminaryhillny is many things: an orchard, with more than more than 60 varieties and 1,500 trees on 12 acres; an eco-friendly cidery meeting PassivHaus standards; a tasting room and restaurant where ciders are paired with fresh, local food; and an enchanting boutique hotel, with 17 units across eight apartments, each unit with their own living room and kitchenette.

Located a stone’s throw from each other, the Boarding House and Seminary Hill’s orchard & tasting room are the perfect fall pairing — offering the unique opportunity to spend the night at New York’s only cidery that allows sleepovers. 

Spend the days hiking nearby trails, or floating down the Delaware River — then head to Seminary Hill tasting room for an unforgettable meal overlooking their scenic orchard. In the morning, sleep in to enjoy a late check-out, then meander through town to browse its antique and boutique shops, grab a meal, shop Callicoon’s famous farmers' market, or see a movie at the amazing @callicoontheater. (See link in bio for our complete area guide!)

This autumn, enjoy 25% off accommodations, plus a complimentary Cider Experience package, exclusive to Escape Brooklyn followers at the Seminary Hill Boarding House, cidery and tasting room.

Offer includes:
🥂 Two bottles of Seminary Hill’s very own cider in room upon arrival;
🍎 $50 credit to redeem at The Tasting Room at Seminary Hill;
📚 A copy of Dan Pucci’s American Cider: A Modern Guide to a Historic Beverage;
⏰ Early check-in and late checkout.

To redeem, use promo code “EscapeBrooklyn" when booking on www.seminaryhill.co 🍎 Offer valid October 9 - December 31, 2023. Excludes October 20-22. Additional blackout dates may apply. 

Photos: 1-6, 8-10 by @hellowithyou; 7 by @escape_brooklyn.

Autumn is officially here, and with it, temperatures that mean crisp air, days spent hiking, and meals by the fireplace. And the return of all things “cozy” — which begs the question, what's cozier than a sauna? 🔥

The Nordic know a thing or two about cozy. According to Wikipedia, in Finland, "sauna is an important part of the national identity. Those who have the opportunity usually take a sauna at least once a week." And then it drops this gem: "The traditional sauna day is Saturday." We can definitely get on board with Sauna Saturdays, and we think you should too.

For the love of saunas, we’ve compiled a list of some hotels & Airbnbs with extraordinary setups in which to get scorched — whether it’s creekside, inside, has room for a party, petite and intimate, or boasts an incredible view. ✨ Find the list at the link in bio. ✨

Photos: 1, 4-7 by Escape Brooklyn; 2 by Sean Davidson; 3 by Ben Fitchett; 8 by Sasithon Photography; 9 by Harrison Lubin.

social_posts.post_text:
October in Upstate is a month that needs no introduction. 🍂 

… But since we’re in the habit of introductions, let us paint the picture: the leaves are changing, the air turns crisp, the pumpkin patches & apple orchards are at peak harvest cuteness, and it’s prime hiking weather. There’s nothing like fall in the mountains.

You should plan a trip, and we can help. 

This month’s Escape Club newsletter has a roundup of discounts exclusive to Escape Club Members, including $100 off midweek stays at @nestledinthecatskills in Margaretville, 15% at @perchcottages Eagle House, 25% off rooms at @seminaryhillny Boarding House (plus a bottle of cider, $50 credit to dining at Seminary Hill Tasting Room and more), and 10% off bookings in November and December at the group-friendly @killercatmountainhouse. We’re also highlighting some Upstate hotel deals & packages we discovered while scouring the internet.

Unlock the discounts, and sign up for the newsletter at the link in bio. 📝✨

Escape Club Memberships are $6/month, $60/annual, and support our tiny, female-led company. We donate 1% to the planet. 🌎 See you out there!

Photos: 1, 2, 5, 8, 10 by @escape_brooklyn; 3 by @hellowithyou; 4 by @dirtandglass; 5 by @uplandcreative.co; 9 c/o @nestledinthecatskills.

Autumnal feels from @hortandpott, a botanically driven concept shop in Freehold, NY. ✨ 

Visit the stunning Catskills shop on weekends this season to peruse their collection of handcrafted uncommon goods, and new natural designs.

Looking to build a brand-new, personalized home? Based in Upstate and Westchester, @homesbywelcome promises that homebuyers can go from mood-board to move-in with just a few clicks. 🪄

Armed with a mood board and a color palette, we worked with Welcome’s designers to easily create an Escape Brooklyn-inspired dream escape — slides 1, 3 and 7 — within Welcome’s Modern Cabin 3 design.

With many active build projects along the East Coast, Welcome has taken the homebuilding process entirely online, and has streamlined into just a handful of simple steps. Here’s how it works:

1️⃣ Use their interactive map to choose your perfect plot of land (don’t worry– they’ve all been analyzed by Welcome’s proprietary AI land-vetting technology, so you know they’re conducive to a build!)

2️⃣ Use their interactive digital design studio to design your home. For any given Welcome home, there are over 200,000 design combination options. No “cookie cutter” vibes, ever.

3️⃣ Make an offer on the land and construction costs. This offer secures your home, as well as a builder. Once your offer is accepted, you sit back, relax (in a cabin somewhere, perhaps?), and let them handle everything else – from permitting, all the way through move-in day.

Whether you’re seeking a forever home, a weekend getaway, or an investment property, check out @homesbywelcome to see some of their active build projects in the Upstate and Westchester areas.

To play around in the digital design studio as we did, head to welcomehomes.com/models — link is in bio — just proceed with caution. It’s addictive! 😉🪄🎨

In Sullivan County, 100 miles from New York City, Livingston Manor describes itself as “a small town with a big yard.” In 2019, Condé Nast declared it the “Catskills’ Newest Hotspot.” Through the two descriptions sound pretty far apart, as Livingston Manor locals with some authority — we agree with both.

Hotspot takes on another meaning in the Catskill Mountains; don’t come to town expecting a cityscape of nightlife and entertainment options. Sure, there are bars — and even a world-class art gallery — but Livingston Manor leans more leisure than excitement. 

This tiny town boasts excellent options for the outdoor-inclined, from world-famous fly fishing on its rivers to miles of hiking trails through its big back yard of forest, waterfalls, lakes and ponds. Livingston Manor is also home to a vibrant community of design, gift and outdoor shops, breweries, restaurants and bars — many of them part of a recent influx of creatives and entrepreneurs from the city. 

The harmonious mix of its outdoor attractions and its great small businesses make Livingston Manor a wonderful place to visit, or live. Maybe even the best (wink, wink).

At the link in bio, check out our updated guide to this very special town we call home — with our favorite spots to explore, eat, drink, shop, stay and more. 

Photos: 1, 2, 4, 6-10 by @escape_brooklyn; 3 by @sasithonphoto; 5 by @hyman.zach.

Thank you for TEN amazing years ✨🥂

I almost never speak in first person, because Escape Brooklyn isn’t about *me* — it’s about growing and sharing Upstate communities and businesses, nature and design inspiration. But, hi, Erin here, founder of this thing. 

Ten years ago life looked different — I worked as a graphic designer, in fashion, in Midtown. I loved my job and I loved NYC, but my heart longed for something else, and whatever it was, I found that outside the big city.

So on weekends I’d head Upstate. At the time, there were virtually no resources on where to go stay in the Catskills or Hudson Valley, or what to do when you got there — and so when a friend suggested I begin a blog, it was a total lightbulb moment. I’d already been calling what I was doing, "Escape Brooklyn" in my head. It was my weekend mantra.

Fast forward to seven years ago: I bid adieu to Brooklyn and moved to Sullivan County in the Catskills. I escaped Brooklyn. These days, I am here, fully immersed in the region I had once only dreamed about living in. I wouldn't trade this community or landscape for anything. Just last week, I found myself shooting a waterfall at peak autumn color (slide 1) and pinched myself. I can’t believe I get to do this for work!

As I wandered down another hiking trail yesterday (slide 2), thinking about this ten year landmark, a moment of deep gratitude struck me (as it often does, multiple times, daily.) It’s been far too long since I said hello, and thanked you all for joining me all these years. Thank you, thank you, thank you! 🙏🏻❤️🫵🏻

This website absolutely would not exist without this incredible community. I hope the things Escape shares brings you joy and inspiration on the regular. If it does (or even if it doesn't), say hello sometime in the DMs, reach out for for recommendations, leave a comment, and please, join our newsletter! Stay in touch, I mean it. 

And again, thank you, thank you, thank you. I so appreciate you being here. ✌🏻❤️

Hear us out: buy an Ugly House 🧟‍♀️🏚️👻 Not a Halloween trick, rather, the topic of our latest real estate newsletter that just went out!

We all know the landscape. In the current market, turn-key dream homes aren’t that attainable. They almost always go into contract within the first week of listing, and almost always over asking price. (Spooky!) There’s too many buyers and too few homes.

That’s why we're giving this unconventional advice. Can’t get an offer accepted on a house you like? Buy an Ugly House, and turn it into an Amazing House. Or a Cute House. Turn it into whatever kind of house you like.

At the link in bio, our Substack newsletter outlines a few reasons why you should consider buying an Ugly House, with some commentary from real estate professionals and renovation experts — including stories from three upstate women who took the plunge on their own Ugly House. Last, to those we inspire, we’ve got some tips on starting your own Ugly House journey.

As a Halloween treat, this month’s newsletter doesn’t include our usual paywall. 🍬🎃 If you enjoy it, subscribe, and help support our tiny, female-led company! 1% goes to the planet. 

Happy H(a)unting! 🧟‍♀️🏚️👻

November is here and we’ve got getaways deals in sooo many ways! 🍂🧳✨ Save big on some of our favorite stays.

At the link in bio, our monthly newsletter (sending out at noon — and always available online post-launch) is hooking up subscribers with 15-25% savings at some of our favorite Airbnb & boutique hotel getaways for November, and beyond into 2024.

Inside the newsletter, preview this month’s deals, and only pay if you want to redeem the monthly discount codes. Link in bio! 🫱🏾‍🫲🏻📝✨

Photos: @dirtandglass, @hellowithyou, @escape_brooklyn, @uplandcreative.co, @awfu, @stephlmossey.

Today the Catskills saw the season’s first snow 🌨️ 

…And in a sudden collision of seasons, many Upstaters got an urgent reminder to finish their garden chores before winter sets in… 🤔

Embrace Winter Magic in the Catskills! 🏔️🏂

As the winter wonderland season approaches the Catskills, @perchcottages invites seasonal renters to experience a season of adventure and relaxation with their monthly rentals, being offered exclusively to Escape Brooklyn followers.

Whether you're a snow enthusiast, a seeker of cozy comforts, or a bit of both, the perfect escape awaits. Here’s the scoop:

🏔️ Rates start at $6K for the entire season, January 1 through March 31. Imagine waking up to crisp mountain air and stunning snowy landscapes every day! Cottages range from 2-3 bedrooms. Single-month rentals are available, as are seasonal rentals.

⛷️ Skiing Paradise Awaits: calling all thrill-seekers and snow lovers! The Catskills boast an array of pristine slopes for skiers of all levels. From beginners to experts, the slopes offer the perfect canvas for your winter adventures. Perch Cottages are located 20 minutes to Belleayre, 30 minutes to Hunter Mountain, and 40 to Windham Mountain. 

🚘 Central location: Perch Cottages is located in Boiceville, in close proximity to Kingston, Stone Ridge, Phoenicia, Woodstock, and more. 

🌬️ Après-Ski Bliss: After an exciting day on the slopes, unwind and indulge in listening to the creek, or hanging by the firepit, overlooking the mountains. 

Head to the link in our bio for more details, or DM @perchcottages directly with inquiries. 

Photos: 1 by Oleg Nagel; 2 c/o @perchcottages; 3, 4, 7, 8, 10 by @escape_brooklyn; 5, 6, 9 by @uplandcreative.co

Call the Catskills “home” this winter! ❄️ ICYMI, our recent Escape Club newsletter outlined four cozy winter rentals for the upcoming season, two of which are featured above.

The first (slides 1-5) is the Shandelee Mountaintop Cottage, perfect for couples and small families. It accommodates four and is pet & kid friendly. Work from home in the large dedicated office, whose sliding doors open to a deck with a hot tub overlooking a snowy wonderland of tall pine trees and a pond. Five minutes to Main Street Livingston Manor, with excellent dining, shopping, hiking, and more.

Second, The Hurley (slides 6-10) accommodates six, with loads of room to spread out between two floors — each with their own living room space. Tucked away on a quiet dead-end road, it’s a five minute walk to Hurleyville’s charming downtown in the beautiful Catskill Mountains.

Both these very stylish and totally cozy homes are available for winter! ⛄️ Hit the link in bio for more details on pricing, additional photos and area info.
Sauna stays: we’ve got ‘em 🔥 At the link in bio, check our list of Upstate getaways with one of our favorite amenities — the beloved sauna — with links to all, plus local recommendations for each.

Weekend inspiration: the just-opened @hemlockneversink in the Catskills — who’s offering some special deals & discounts! ✨ #smallbusinesssaturday 

115 miles from NYC, Hemlock Neversink offers an escape for personal restoration. The serene 230 acre campus features a wellness hotel with spa treatments, indoor pool and hot tub, saunas and private trails. Activities include goat hikes, yoga, meditation, bonfires, workshops, culinary classes and more to keep guests busy. (Or, unwind and do nothing at all!)

At Hemlock Neversink, an all-inclusive rate includes all meals, activities, workshops and a dedicated Experience Guide. The Spa houses 12 treatment rooms, a meadow-view gym, indoor pool and hot tub, saunas, steam room, movement building (slide 1), sun deck and relaxation room. 

To celebrate their opening, there’s a few great offers just in time for the holiday season! See a full list at the link in bio, or choose from our picks below:

🧳 Book a four night stay and get the 4th night on the house. Use code “4YOU” at checkout.
🧖🏼‍♀️ Gift card special! For every $100 spent on a gift card, they’ll top it off with $25 extra. Treat your loved ones to a spa day, a nice dinner or cozy weekend getaway at any @fostersupplyhospitality hotel, restaurant or spa.
🌲 There’s something even more relaxing about a midweek escape! Hemlock’s Midweek Wellness package includes all meals, classes, a 20% midweek discount for stays during Monday-Thursday, and a 10% retail discount. Two night minimum. Contact stay@hemlockneversink.com or call in to book this offer. 

Check out these, and more introductory offers, at the link in bio. ✨

Photos: 1, 4A, 5, 6, 8 by @uplandcreative.co; 2 by @theonefortytwo; 3, 4B, 10 by @sasithonphoto; 7A, 7B, 9 by @clay.banks.

Meet Ben the Donkey (#benthedonkey) — important flock member, protector of the sheep at @studiohillvt and all-around good guy. ✨

Southern Vermont regenerative farm @studiohillvt has three Airbnb offerings, ranging in amenities, capacity and rates. Its two-bedroom schoolhouse was featured in Airbnb Magazine and boasts a sauna & hot tub. A cliffside yurt outfitted with a king bed is perfect for nature-lovers, slowing you down to the rhythm of the forest. Last, its expansive but cozy Hilltop House boasts a hot tub, 360º sweeping mountain views, and accommodates up to 11 guests.

Guests at each may wander the trails around the property, book a guided nature tour, or simply spend time gazing out the windows as wildlife, or the sheep meander past. 🐑 All on the setting of a fifth generation family-run farm you can feel great about supporting.

Links to all info at the @studiohillvt link in bio. 

Photos: @studiohillvt

Season’s greetings to everyone ☃️ especially to those of us who can’t believe it’s December and that 2023 is almost over (how?!)

Straight from our outbox 📤 and into your inbox 📥, today’s Escape Club newsletter goes out at noon. This month and the 1st of every month, sign up to save big on some of our favorite Upstate stays — and make the most of the rest of this year. (Or make the most of next year too, and gift a subscription 🎁😘)

Preview this month’s discount partners in the gallery, check out our IG stories today for details, or just head straight on over to the link in bio to sign up. 💌 If you miss the noon deadline, don’t sweat it — the entire archive is always online, also at the link in bio.

Photos: 1 by @dirtandglass; 2-3 by @escape_brooklyn; 4 by @stephlmossey; 5, 9 by @clay.banks; 6 by Trevor Moran; 7-8 by @studiohillvt; 10 by @perchcottages

Last night, the Catskill Mountains got its first significant snowfall, with some areas reporting up to 12” ⛄️ We’re so here for it! 

Here’s a video from today in Livingston Manor — plus some snowy shots from last year’s first big storm, taken for @callicoonhills. 

Happy winter! ⛄️⛄️⛄️

It’s *that* season and the @homestedt team has done it again! ✨

The Catskills-based design duo just finished a new project in which they lovingly restored a beloved local landmark — North Branch Cider Mill — and filled it with some wonderful gifts for the season! 

From pantry staples to adorable mouse lights, candy to candles, and holiday decorations to Scandinavian sheepskins, it’s quickly becoming a local favorite; above, we’re sharing a few highlights including some perfect presents 🎁🎄 

Get in the holiday spirit and visit the North Branch Cider Mill, open Tuesday-Sunday 10-5pm — or shop online, where everything ordered will ship priority (read: in time for gifting!) through the rest of December. Happy Holidays!

Photos: 1, 3, 4, 6, 7-10 by @pbcrosby; 2, 5 by @catskillimage

📍 The Dream: a cabin high atop Balsam Lake Mountain, NY — surrounded by nothing but snow capped pine trees.

This is the view from Balsam Lake Fire Tower near Livingston Manor, NY. This incredible 4.3 mile trail in the #CatskillMountains climbs 1,200 in elevation up the westernmost of the Catskills’ high peaks (35 mountains over 3,500 feet) reaching ~3,700 feet. 

We love this trail during winter, though it’s not for the faint of heart. The road to get there ices over early, and the journey up isn’t easy. But the views are 😍

If you go: wear winter appropriate shoes/gear, be prepared for the worst, and remember to #leavenotrace. (Seriously — we’ll find you!) Happy trails!

Pet appreciation post: we ❤️ our furry friends — and we know you do, too! 🐶 

With that in mind, we’re creating a list of the pet-friendliest hotels & Airbnbs in the Upstate region, to share with you all. 

Know someone who deserves to be on the list? Tag ‘em! Got a cute photo of your dog Upstate that you’d like to see featured? @ us with a #escapedog! Are you a pet-friendly hotel or Airbnb? Leave us a 🐶 👋🏻 ❤️ in the comments! 

This and many more lists coming in 2024 — what other kinds of lists would you like to see?! ✍️
